49e5f50d2f7db1abf3c69c779b794d28 (00:37): tpope: back to the matter at hand...quick question: I :so % and it installed rails.vba... now what? with regards to the syntax stuff...

0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (00:37): I'd be lying if I said there was a conflict though

609252e8595f84db3ab53f287c7d4dea (00:38): ciaranm: Looks like the typo of the day to me
609252e8595f84db3ab53f287c7d4dea (00:38): yeah, blame it on the keyboard
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (00:38): the_mug: edit a file from your rails application and it should auto-activate
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (00:38): there's no way i could've typoed *that* badly
49e5f50d2f7db1abf3c69c779b794d28 (00:39): tpope: what can I do to evidence the fact that it installed?
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (00:40): edit a model and see if has_many is highlighted
49e5f50d2f7db1abf3c69c779b794d28 (00:41): tpope: I opened the controller and then :REmodel and it open that controller's model!
49e5f50d2f7db1abf3c69c779b794d28 (00:42): tpope: however the has_many is not highlighted... could my .vimrc be overriding some of the stuff
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (00:43): is there something new in the statusline?
49e5f50d2f7db1abf3c69c779b794d28 (00:43): hold on ... let me jump in my server and see what it looks like w/o rails.vim

009c8e8bbad442db8e6712cf3c2ec6af (00:44): Does anyone know if there's a way to make word wrap indent, so that when there's a long line that's tabbed over, the wrapped portion will also be tabbed over?
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (00:44): the default highlighting is just like :symbols
49e5f50d2f7db1abf3c69c779b794d28 (00:45): tpope: nm. it is actually highlighted
49e5f50d2f7db1abf3c69c779b794d28 (00:45): tpope: what about syntax completion? is that possible?
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (00:47): I hope you did :h key-notation when I said to earlier
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (00:47): there are two forms, a built in ruby completion, and a rails based completion
49e5f50d2f7db1abf3c69c779b794d28 (00:50): but isn't the rails.vba (rails.vim) the rails based completion?
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (00:52): rails.vim is a lot of things.  it does provide the <C-X><C-U> completion
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (00:53): <C-X><C-O> is ruby based completion, included with vim 7
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (03:46): does anyone else find vim's ftp support rather buggy?
6103130184a5cb2706eb422698d9c151 (03:46): i often can't scroll or can scroll too far horizontally and sometimes writing files floods the bottom of my screen
ff5faa9bf0174eaac55c092ea74f73fb (03:59): is there umm anyway to have vim us "my" config even after i su
ff5faa9bf0174eaac55c092ea74f73fb (04:00): there is no way for it to see
ff5faa9bf0174eaac55c092ea74f73fb (04:00): i stay away from sudo as much as possible :x
8bece2647a39db763401c1e98abe5854 (04:01): I use sudo because it means every single action I take as root is logged in a logfile, so I can go back and find what actions I took
fca2fab4a7479513eb5b2990a79704d3 (04:01): well, sudo or using "su -" then vim
fca2fab4a7479513eb5b2990a79704d3 (04:02): you could change the vimrc in /etc/
ff5faa9bf0174eaac55c092ea74f73fb (04:03): [joshuah]; i was kind of going for... "dont change it for everyone just me when i su"
fca2fab4a7479513eb5b2990a79704d3 (04:05): and calling your users vim on commandline? sudo vim -u $HOME/.vimrc ?
ff5faa9bf0174eaac55c092ea74f73fb (04:05): ill deal without syntax highlighting for a few minutes ;)
fca2fab4a7479513eb5b2990a79704d3 (04:06): you can always source hightlight files
